intro: Asimitellaria kiusiana, commonly known as the Kiusian sand mat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asteraceae family. It is native to the arid regions of southern Africa, particularly Namibia and South Africa. The plant is characterized by its low-growing, mat-forming structure with dense clusters of small, yellowish flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to reduce water loss in harsh environments. Asimitellaria kiusiana plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and provides habitat for various small insects and arthropods.
